title: Lead Data Scientist 3, Words with Friends
descr: Zynga is a leading developer of the world s most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. To-date, more than 1 billion people have played our games across Web and mobile, including Words With Friends, FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Merge Dragons, Empires & Puzzles, Hit it Rich! Slots and CSR.Zynga s data science and analytics team uses our unique and expansive data to model and predict user behavior, making our games more personalized and more fun to play! We strive for a better understanding of our players which translates into challenges and features that delight them and increased social engagement within our games.Here s where you would come in: identify and formalize problems to understand user behavior. Create systems and analyses to derive insights that change the studio s world view. Be innovative, be creative, use every bit of that key commodity   data. Millions of people play Zynga games every day, so our data is tremendously rich and we have a lot of it!We will rely on you to communicate your findings to your peers   both technical and non-technical. Your solutions to difficult problems will need to be demonstrably impactful, visual and maintainable. You will work with our game teams to put your models into production. You will collaborate with Product Managers, Game Designers, and Engineers to deliver business impact, changing current practices in line with new findings and insights.Role Responsibilities:Work with large amounts of data to find opportunities to improve the experience that Zynga provides to its playersDefine analytics and data science roadmap, balancing actionable insights to substantially improve core game metricsDrive and empower game studio to make quantitatively informed, evidence based decisionsWork closely with game team to design, test, verify and implement machine learning models with Zynga s games that impact millions of usersDesign and evaluate novel scalable approaches to experimentationDesired Skills and Experience:BS in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field; Masters, MBA or PhD preferred5+ years of work experience in data science or analytics rolesFluent in SQL; Strong experience with programming in Python and/or R; Adept in at least one visualization tool such as Tableau, or QlikViewDemonstrated experience with some or all of the following: statistics, experimental design, machine learning, data mining, predictive modeling, deep learningExperience in analyzing large datasets, preferably in a Hadoop or Spark environment, and deploying production-ready systems at scaleStrong written and oral communication skillsAbility to work effectively in a fast-paced environment with changing prioritiesAbility to collaborate effectively with engineers, product managers, analysts, and marketing to deliver unambiguous business impactStrong passion for gaming!What we offer you:Zynga Stock RSUs and Bonus PlanFull medical, dental, vision benefits as well as life insuranceCatered lunch dailyGenerous Paid Maternity/Paternity leaveOpen vacation policy for many employeesFlexible working hours on many teamsCasual dress every single dayWork with cool people!Zynga is an equal opportunity employer. We are proud of our diverse community; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, disability, or any other class or characteristic protected by applicable law. We welcome candidates, players, employees, and partners from all backgrounds. Join us!Zynga will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law.

title: Intern - Software Developer, MS IT (16 month contract)
descr: The OpportunityRoles Available: 3April 2020 - August 2021Do you want to learn a wide variety of technical skills while working with a highly collaborative agile development team?As an Intern - Software Developer you ll be paired with an experienced Software Developer as your mentor who will be your guide as you learn our wide range of front-end and back-end technologies while becoming a core developer on our product team. As a 16-month Intern you ll be working with a product team for the first 8 months where you ll learn the essential technical and collaboration skills to allow you to be a key contributor at Ontario Teachers . For the second 8 months, you ll have an opportunity to transition to a new team where you ll be working with different technologies, different people, be given more responsibility and deliver higher complexity solutions. During your time at Ontario Teachers  you ll also have free time to explore new technologies unrelated to your regular project work and deliver presentations on those technologies as well as other project work to our development team.Features of this position:Flexible work hours and dress codeFriendly business environmentTeam focused problem solving and solution deliveryStrong peer support, mentorship and code review from senior developersTechnical research, demos and discussions for sharing ideas and brainstorming complex problemsTime to explore and experiment with emerging technologiesConnected to the TTC subway and the Finch Bus Terminal (serves GO Transit, York Region Transit/Viva and Brampton Transit)Who you ll work withCollaboration is integral to your work at Ontario Teachers  and you ll be working with people as much as you ll be working with code. Whether it s designing solutions on the whiteboard directly with our customers, pairing on code reviews, working with Testers on test coverage results or helping trace a problem in our production environment, there s always an engaging discussion to help improve your software solutions. You ll be working on a small agile team (4-7 people) but will have the support and knowledge of our 35+ Software Development team and its wide range of full-stack development experience.What you ll doUse the latest development tools: Eclipse/IntelliJ IDEA, WebStorm, Atom on Linux/WindowsDeliver business services using Java and SpringBuild apps using the latest web technology including Angular, React, jQuery, HTML 5Learn the real-world usage of version control and code reviews (Github), automated build (Maven), and continuous integration (Atlassian Bamboo)Automate your deployment and monitoring (Ruby, Chef and Cloud Foundry)Collaborate with your team members and customers (in-person and via Hipchat)Track your work using our issue tracker (JIRA) and share your designs on our wiki (Confluence)What you ll needProgram of study in Mathematics, Computer Science, or EngineeringProfessional software development experience from previous work terms (preferred)Strong design and coding skillsExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsExperience with Object Oriented Programming languages: Java, C++/C#, Python, Ruby and/or web technologies: Angular, React, JavaScriptFamiliarity with the following is an asset:Eclipse/IntelliJ IDEAJava technologies (Java, Spring, Tomcat)Web service technologies such as REST/JSON and/or SOAP/XMLWeb technologies and frameworks such as Angular, React, jQuery, HTML 5Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)Quotes from previous students My work term at Teachers' has been truly a unique and memorable experience. Flexible hours, comfortable work environment, and welcoming co-workers made it an easy decision to return for a second term. What was most important was the practical skills and work ethics that I gained and would carry into the rest of my work terms and my professional career.  Charles Yeung, Computer Engineering I was assigned to a formal development project right away, and exposed to the process that entails. I learned about Web Security, working closely with my team members. I communicated with team members about coding style and procedures, informally and through code reviews, which improved my programming ability. I'm confident the skills I developed at OTPP will provide future intriguing opportunities. My experiences at OTPP will be an excellent foundation for the rest of my career.  Tom Joynt, Software Engineering Working at Teachers' helped me evolve as a software developer by providing me with mentor figures to learn from and the opportunity to make meaningful contributions to large, long lived software projects. I will especially miss the commitment at Teachers  to continuous learning and self-improvement, emphasized through internal software conferences, frequent code reviews and constant encouragement to seek out new technologies and introduce them to the team.  Neil Newman, Engineering Science (Electrical and Computer)What we re offeringAt Ontario Teachers , diversity is one of our core strengths. We are a globally minded organization and take pride ensuring that the people we hire and the culture we create reflect and celebrate diversity of thought, background and experience.Accommodations are available upon request for candidates with a disability taking part in the recruitment process and once hired.How to applyAre you ready to make a meaningful impact to our customers while building your technical skills and strong relationships? Submit your application online at www.otpp.com/careers and apply to Req #2294. Please include the following documents to your application:Cover letterResumeCopy of your transcriptsThis internship takes place during the Summer 2020 work term and the duration is 16 months.The deadline to apply for this role is November 15, 2019.We thank you for applying, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. Note that candidates must be legally entitled to work in the country where this role is located.#LI-DNPFunctional Area:AdministrationRequisition ID:2294The privacy of your personal information is important to us. Please visit our Privacy Centre to learn how we handle your personal information.

title: Associate Technical Director
descr: We re looking for leaders to help our business grow. You re a veteran of web or mobile development, comfortable in front of a client, and ready to lead a team to deliver top-notch solutions. You re smart, and you have a list of applications delivered to prove it.As an Associate Technical Director, you ll report to one of our Technology leaders with a focus on a defined portfolio of clients. You require knowledge of Application Development, Web Development, Quality Assurance, and Systems Administration as you will be representing all of these disciplines on your accounts.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:Understands business problems to be solved, and provides technical direction and solution during all phases, including discovery, pre-sales, definition, and delivery.Provides estimates for projects for all technical disciplines, and involves other discipline leads where appropriate.Consulting clients with required technical and business solutions.Ensures project managers are equipped to monitor project cost, risk, and timelines.Serves as standard escalation point for the project management team for any project risks, costs, and duration.Ensures the quality of all technical outputs meets expectations.Maintains lasting client relationships, particularly with IT departments, through both remote and on-site meetings across North America.Maintains long-term and big-picture plans for client systems, architectures and technical environment.Identifies new opportunities in day-to-day communication, and communicates them to the core team.Defines, communicates and enforces necessary standards and regulatory compliance, particularly in relation to security and privacy.Manages a team of developers and other technical staff.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience. Academic excellence preferred.8+ years of industry experience in technology3+ years experience in a cross-functional role, or 2 year+ experience in at least 2 of the following disciplines: Architecture design, Application Development, Web Development, Quality Assurance, Data, Analytics, Enterprise systemsIn-depth knowledge of cloud computing infrastructure, risk management/compliance, and related information security requirementsApplication development experience in any of the following technologies: JAVA, .NET, PHP, Python, NodeJS or Javascript frameworks (Angular, React or any other framework)Working knowledge of any of the following cloud platforms: AWS, GCP or AzureKnowledge of systems integrations   REST, SOA, Microservices, OAuth, SSOKnowledge of modern tech stack such as Serverless, NoSQL, CI/CD is an assetKnowledge of DevOps tools like GIT, Jenkin, Shell Script, Docker2+ years of experience in people managementExcellent customer service skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsTeam orientation and sparkling interpersonal skillsWe look forward to hearing from you!

title: Sr. Developers / Designers - Parallel Processing
descr: L3Harris is dedicated to recruiting and developing diverse, high-performing talent who are passionate about what they do. Our employees are unified in a shared dedication to our customers  mission and quest for professional growth. L3Harris provides an inclusive, engaging environment designed to empower employees and promote work-life success. Fundamental to our culture is an unwavering focus on values, dedication to our communities, and commitment to excellence in everything we do.L3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers  mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across air, land, sea, space and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $17 billion in annual revenue, 50,000 employees and customers in more than 130 countries. L3Harris.comGPU Processing Developer/DesignerDeep Learning and Image ProcessingAbout L3Harris WESCAMWe are an extraordinary company.We develop the most advanced multi-spectral, multi-sensor optical systems for global defense and military markets, National Security, Search & Rescue and Airborne law enforcement agencies worldwide. These systems provide stabilized, high-magnification Electro-optic and Infrared (EO/IR) laser, surveillance and targeting systems for airborne, marine and ground based platforms.To see more about L3Harris WESCAM, go to https://www.youtube.com/user/saleswescam or visit https://www.wescam.com/About the RoleWe re looking to add some senior developers to our team who (ideally) have a rich background in not only GPU coding   but who are further capable of modelling and designing in an algorithm based environmentWe re way beyond hand-writing code anymore. With a massive legacy code base, our product-customization and increasingly complex systems combined with higher-than-ever volumes   we re building a better mousetrap.With the immense quantity of data that our optical systems manage   Distributed computing along with GPU processing is the answer.GPU processing isn t entirely new to us, but we re leveraging it at the best time in its evolution. Combining Deep Learning and Data Science for image processing is key for us in allowing our systems to process extraordinary amounts of data from multiple electro-optical systems in fractions of a second.We are currently working on an advanced intelligence and surveillance program involving Infrared Surface Tracking for naval environments that require processing massive amounts of data driven by multiple optical systems operating concurrently. This volume and complexity of data will be supported by a GPU-farm and card arrays that will employ AI/Deep Learning for image clutter suppression, object detection and more. It is this GPU  brain  that we are developing not only for this current program, but for future programs as well.Education & Expertise We Look ForComputer Science Degree/Diploma preferredAbility to formulate and articulate complex design concepts in a high-performance computing environmentMature/advanced coding and design abilitiesExpertise in GPU coding and designAbility to model and design the framework and algorithms that our GPU processing environment will operate inSome experience with Image Processing, High-Speed/Performance Processing, Deep Learning would be a valuable asset (but not a primary skill).Tools, Languages, Skills and Attributes We Look ForYou must be able to obtain a security clearance / Controlled Good Program clearanceLooking to do something completely different with your coding careerAbility to understand the design and interpret the operation of complex, interrelated subsystemsDeep curiosity combined with highly-advanced problem solving capabilitiesNVidia CUDAOperating Systems expertise with Embedded Linux, RTOS (or Greenhill, WindRiver, ThreadX)Platform expertise to include GPU (preferably), or ARM or x86Language proficiency / coding maturity with C/C++, Matlab and PythonPrevious deployment experience of model-based development, Deep Learning or Big DataLife at L3Harris WESCAMThis is the most important part. Many companies say that their work is  exciting  or  challenging , or that they work in a fast-paced environment. Perhaps our definition of those terms is slightly different   because we are one of the only companies in the world that produce what we do, have customers like we do, allow our employees to work on the kinds of things we do, and say with certainty that what we do every day directly contributes to protecting lives around the world.What else can you expect as an L3Harris WESCAM employee?Every other Friday offSubsidized gourmet caf sFree fruit and bagelsFree wellness programsWork/Life balance that is taken seriouslyReal opportunities for growth, development and career progressionEveryone s role at L3Harris WESCAM contributes to protecting people s livesFor more information, go to www.wescam.comDiversity & InclusionWe believe that diversity among our employees makes us a stronger organization.We are committed to diversity and inclusion within our L3 WESCAM family, and our community by welcoming and encouraging applications from anyone interested without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran's status, Aboriginal status or any other legally protected groups. For people with disabilities, we work with you throughout the recruitment process to ensure you have what you need in order to be at your best. If you require any accommodation for any part of the recruitment/interview process, or as you begin, you career with us, just let us know and we will take care of you.About L3Harris TechnologiesL3Harris Technologies is an agile global aerospace and defense technology innovator, delivering end-to-end solutions that meet customers  mission-critical needs. The company provides advanced defense and commercial technologies across air, land, sea, space and cyber domains. L3Harris has approximately $17 billion in annual revenue, 50,000 employees and customers in more than 130 countries. L3Harris.com#LI-FD1Please be aware many of our positions require the ability to obtain a security clearance. Security clearances may only be granted to U.S. citizens. In addition, applicants who accept a conditional offer of employment may be subject to government security investigation(s) and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.By submitting your r sum  for this position, you understand and agree that L3Harris Technologies may share your r sum , as well as any other related personal information or documentation you provide, with its subsidiaries and affiliated companies for the purpose of considering you for other available positions.L3Harris Technologies is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. L3Harris is committed to treating all employees and applicants for employment with respect and dignity and maintaining a workplace that is free from unlawful discrimination. All applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or other related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, characteristic or membership in any other group protected by federal, state or local laws. L3Harris maintains a drug-free workplace and performs pre-employment substance abuse testing and background checks, where permitted by law.

title: Team Lead, Analytics Engineering
descr: Are you interested in working for a company as ubiquitous to Canadians as Interac and helping provide insights on and improve products used billions of times a year? Do you like the idea of tuning spark jobs and SQL queries that run on hundreds of terabytes of data?We're looking to hire a Team Lead for the Analytics Engineering team at Interac. Acting as a technical lead with 3 other specialists of analytics engineering, you would report to the Chief Data Officer and be responsible for translating high-level business requirements into technical solutions, then implementing them with the help of your team and others in the org. On a day-to-day basis, you would be working closely with the Research & Engineering team (Data Scientists), Analytics Delivery team (BI) and Data Engineering Team. You'd also be regularly coordinating with Infrastructure (Operations/DevOps), Security, and Risk to ensure things move forward. This role is best filled by a seasoned software developer or data engineer with an interest in data science, one who is happy building tools/applications and turning research into reproducible products/solutions.The team's responsibilities include Working with the Research/Engineering team (data scientists) to turn their research and proof of concept into reproducible jobs that can be handed off to the Data Engineering teamBuilding out and maintaining and an internal web application to index and display reports and research generated by the other data teamsWorking with Data Engineering on extending functionality of the Data Environment based on requirements from the rest of the teamBuilding and/or deploying internal tools to solve problems or improve processes for the other data teamsThese can be anything from custom-build CLI tools, web-apps, purchased software products, or AWS services as appropriate, automating process through a pipelineAutomate processes for analyticsResearch and deploy on strategies for improving the efficiency of analytic processesOperationalize data product for self-serve by the business unitsYou're great at Working with your team to turn business requirements into possible solutionsEnsuring stakeholders understand the trade-offs of the various implementation options and getting buy-in for oneCoordinating external dependencies and requirements for a given implementation (security, DBA, ops, legal, project managers, change management)Removing blockers for your team, especially around process and externalsEnsuring that work is being done in a sustainable/maintainable manner to minimize technical debtIdentifying problems that could be solved and technical debt that should be addressed ahead of net-new workEncouraging software dev best practicesWorking with the CDO to prioritize tasks and projectsMaking life easier for those around youWho are you?You have 2+ years working in software development, ideally working on live products with complex upstream and downstream dependencies or 2+ years working in data science/data engineering teams that involved deliverables to external partiesThis experience should include working closely with engineering teams to build product features based on your workYou have leadership experience, either a team you've led or managed, or on a project or system you've taken ownership ofYou have professional experience using python in at least two of following categories:building (and/or maintaining) web-services or a web application with external consumers/customerswriting production-quality ETLs with upstream and downstream dependenciesdelivering an end-to-end analysis/predictive modelling task including data prep and presenting/deploying the resultsbuilding internal tooling/pipelines for technical end-usersYou possess excellent communication skills and comfort interfacing with people with a wide variety of technical backgrounds and skillsets including: Infrastructure/DevOps engineers, software developers, report developers, data scientists/statisticians, DBAs/data engineers, security experts, product, project managers, business analysts, legal representatives, executivesYou have strong knowledge around accessing and manipulating large amounts of dataIt's assumed you know SQL, but you should also have a good intuition of network, disk, memory and processor bottlenecks for queries you runYou should also understand how this change when working against distributed systems on HDFSYou have a 4-Year undergraduate degree in a related field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, etc.) or equivalent work experienceIt would be an asset if you have:experience with start-to-finish data science/predictive modelling projectscomfort level with web development and familiarity with front-end developmentOps or DBA experience on teams responsible for production systemsProficiency in a JVM-based languageExperience with Spark on YARN and Hive (We're on a Cloudera stack)Cloud development experience (AWS)A master's degree in a related fieldFamiliarity with finance or fintechHow we workWe know that exceptional people have great ideas and are passionate about their work. Our culture encourages excellence and actively rewards contributions with:Connection: You're surrounded by talented people every day who are driven by their passion of a common goal.Core Values: They define us. Living them helps us be the best at what we do.Compensation & Benefits: Pay is driven by individual and corporate performance and we provide a multitude of benefits and perks.Education: To ensure you are the best at what you do we invest in you.About InteracInterac Corp. operates an economical, world-class debit payments system with broad-based acceptance, reliability, security, and efficiency. The organization is one of Canada's leading payments brands and is chosen an average of 16 million times daily to pay and exchange money. For more than 30 years, Interac Corp. and its predecessors, Interac Association and Acxsys Corporation, have facilitated secure financial transactions through the development of innovative and convenient debit and money transfer solutions. A leader in the prevention and detection of fraud, the organization has one of the lowest rates of fraud globally. Visit interac.ca or follow @INTERAC on Twitter. Interac Corp. has a diverse group of shareholders that includes banks, credit unions, caisses populaires, payment processors and merchants.Interac Corp. believes in providing an inclusive workplace where all individuals have the opportunity to succeed. We are committed to doing so by providing accessible employment practices. Contact a member of the Human Resources department if you need accommodation at any point in the application process or want more information about our Accessibility Policy, which is also available online here.cqSvdAr67I

title: DevOps Engineer
descr: Are you a passionate DevOps Engineer looking to work in a dynamic, collaborative work environment on cutting edge digital products? If so, this may be the opportunity you have been looking for where you can really flourish and strut your DevOps acumen in this fun & open work culture that embraces automation with a focus on site reliability and performance.Located in the middle of all the action in downtown Toronto, if you enjoy sports, street culture and sipping espresso at the local hipster haunts, this HQ is ideally located.A high aptitude & ability to build out the infrastructure automation, make software upgrades, conduct general infrastructure improvements, and other project-based work is required.A background working with Containerization (Docker & Kubernetes preferred); automation experience with configuration management and infrastructure as code tools is a must. Terraform (preferred), Ansible, Helm, etc.; experience with a programming language (Bash & Python preferred); extensive experience in Linux; & experience working with AWS, GCP, and other cloud providers.A combination of a developer and systems administration background would be ideal.The key elements are Docker and Kubernetes on the containerization side, Terraform on automation and in terms of cloud, the preference is for a candidate with experience on AWS and GCP but we'll consider somebody with strong AWS experience who is willing to learn GCP.The confidence you have in skills & experience related to the above requirements will make the pre-requisite technical challenge presented to you at the beginning of the hiring cycle a breeze.If interested in discussing further, don t hesitate, send us your resume and give us a call to set up a time to discuss the opportunity and your qualifications in further detail.We would like to thank you personally for applying to Step by Step Professional Services Inc. Please note that we will review your application and only those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted directly. However, we will retain your application on file and would be pleased to contact you if further opportunities arise.

title: MoCap Tools Developer

You will be working with a talented core team of passionate and committed individuals to work on some of the largest scale projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You will have the opportunity to build and develop new tools and pipelines used across all our studios in a friendly and inclusive environment where you can collaborate with some of the most accomplished and driven people in the industry.WHAT WE DOSupport the existing motion capture pipeline and all the studios that utilize it.Design and build tools for the entire MoCap pipeline, from pre-production planning to post-production to animation.Build new tools to improve efficiency and turnaround times.Research, spec out, and pitch new concepts and applications.RESPONSIBILITIESHelp to elevate our state-of-the-art MoCap pipelines by deeper integration and collaboration with other DCC packages and systems.Maintain and extend these systems based on input from development/production for both short term projects and longer term goals.Extend and create new tools and workflows for real-time visualization of performance capture.Collaborate with animators and production to develop efficient workflows and supporting tools.Develop software to enhance existing 2D/3D tracking solutions, image-based data capture, and motion re-targeting systems.Participate in discussions surrounding future workflow and tool development.Support and troubleshoot tools in a live production motion capture stage environment.REQUIREMENTS3+ years of Python experience, preferably in a Linux environment.An in-depth understanding of motion capture systems and the underpinning principal technologies involved.Ability to write custom tools for a motion capture animation pipeline.SQL, Mongo, or similar enterprise level database server experience.3+ years of experience working with 3D animation and modeling software (MotionBuilder, Maya).Create custom tools and scripts to increase the productivity and efficiency of the production team.Ability to adapt to evolving tasks and priorities as directed by stage production requirements.Keep up to date with new technologies and continue to improve on the existing workflow.Experience working with both Windows and Linux platforms.Ability to communicate well with teammates from a wide variety of disciplines.DESIRED SKILLSExperience developing graphical user interfaces   ideally writing Qt GUIs in Python and/or C++.3+ years of industry experience using motion capture technology.Passion for playing and making video games.

title: Automation Developer Co-Op- Winter 2020

title: Senior Application Developer
descr: UHN is the largest combined Clinical and Research entity in Canada, made up of hospitals which individually are also among the largest and highest profile institutions in Canada: The Princess Margaret Cancer Centre; Toronto General Hospital; Toronto Western Hospital; and the Toronto Rehabilitation Institute. UHN has a combined IT group under the name  Digital  servicing these entities and is broken down into 4 key business areas with numerous inter-dependencies: Clinical, Corporate, Education and Research. The current posting is for a position within UHN Digital which overlaps between Digital Research and the Digital Cardiac IT department. For more information on UHN, please visit www.uhn.ca.Overview of the Position: Senior Software DeveloperThis position is for a senior software developer to join a diverse team of passionate specialists who are working on creating a next generation platform (data lake) for storage and mining of patient data. Our data sources span everything from standard electronic medical record type entries and lab results to DNA sequencing data and diagnostic imaging. Our goal is to provide a robust and scalable platform to effectively integrate and facilitate the analysis of  Big Data  for purposes of research hypotheses testing and quality of care improvement.Our team works in a casual work environment with a lot of energy and initiative. As a member of our team you will have an opportunity to participate in the decision-making process during design and development of the applications. We have a heavy preference in using open-source tools. Our architecture favors the microservice design pattern, with JSON for data-interchange format. Most of our data-store is no-SQL MongoDB, with some additional relational data in PostgreSQL. We develop primarily using Golang, however it is also common to encounter and use Python, Java, Ruby, and other programming languages. Our targeted deployment platform is Kubernetes and Linux Docker-runtime environments.This position will help develop a variety of applications which have a direct impact on patient care at UHN.Responsibilities:The selected candidate will design and develop software for the data lake, primarily in Golang, although other languages may be required. The produced software will typically (in the immediate term) comprise of back-end microservices that process the data in the data lake. Processing of the data includes: integrating external data sources, implementation of search/retrieve API (GraphQL), anonymization, facilitation of  Big Data  analysis, etc.The developer will be responsible for the full life-cycle of software delivery. This includes: requirement gathering, design, implementation along with testing, deployment and maintenance (troubleshooting, bug fixes). Documentation will also be required through various steps in the process (loosely modeled on Agile).Required Attributes:Computer Science/Engineering Degree, BSc, MSc, PHd or equivalent demonstrable qualificationsRecent relevant work experience and minimum 5 years overall relevant work experienceStrong coding and problem-solving skillsExperience designing and implementing complex software systemsGIT version control, and experience with its workflowsLinux based OS and working in a command line environmentAdditional Attributes Considered as an Asset:Experience with any/all: Golang, Python, Java, C#, C, C++. Golang preferred.Experience with CI tools: GitlabCIExperience with no-SQL (MongoDB) and/or RDMS (PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc)Experience with GraphQLExperience working on cloud infrastructure, Docker and KubernetesExperience with Messaging Systems: NATS/JMS/MQExperience with FHIR and RESTful web servicesExperience with medical standards: HL7, DICOMExperience with  Big Data  tools such as Map/Reduce and HadoopExperience with implementing secure systems: PKI, OAuth2, and general principles of security and privacySelf-motivated and able to learn new technologies quicklyExperience working in highly regulated industriesAbility to function productively on multiple project teams simultaneouslyAbility to work independently, with minimal supervisionEffective time managementExcellent oral and written communications skillsPosting Dates: August 21, 2019 : Until Filled Job # 845817For current University Health Network employees: only those who have successfully completed their probationary period, have a good employee record along with satisfactory attendance in accordance with UHN's attendance management program, and possess all the required experience and qualifications should apply.UHN Digital thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the Bona-fide for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted. For more information about UHN, do visit www.uhn.ca

title: DevOps Developer
descr: About BonsaiBonsai s mission is to help people find and buy the products they want, as soon as they realize they want them. We began in 2016 as a streetwear style and news app. Now we re leading the market shift to content-driven commerce. Bonsai is partnered with 30 of the world s largest publishers and has integrated 1,200 brands. Our team is 35-strong and we ve raised $11M in venture capital.Our technology allows users to transact natively while browsing content. We make the journey from seeing a product to buying it possible in two taps. Our vision is to make this possible everywhere you discover products. For publishers, we provide a powerful revenue alternative to ads that also improves the user experience. Bonsai allows merchants to capture customers while they browse content, right when purchasing intent is being formed.At Bonsai, we pride ourselves on the transparent and performance-driven environment we ve created for our team. We value making data driven-decisions and taking calculated risks that add value to our users.The RoleWe are looking for a new DevOps developer to become an integral part of our development community. You will be helping to drive the direction of technology, strategizing on how to implement new infrastructure and practices. You will also help introduce new tools and paradigms to the company inline with emerging best practices and latest technology trends.Challenges You'll SolveUsing Google Cloud Platofrm, Kubernetes, Docker to create and manage infrastructure as codeWork to automate the development, monitoring and deployment process as much as possibleRevamp, and rebuild from scratch continuous integration and deployment systemsDesigning monitoring & deploymentPrevent and chase down fires in a newly scaling startup with concerns from hundreds of users and hundreds of millions of usersRequirements for the roleIn-depth knowledge of KubernetesIn-depth knowledge and experience of DockerProficient scripting skills in Python and ShellSome experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)Some experience in GraphQL or RESTBe open to giving and receiving feedback and constructive criticismBe passionate about all things tech. Excited about learning and adopting the latest technologies and toolsSystem networking knowledgeBonus ExperienceDevOps experienceNodeJS experienceGraph database (DGraph especially) experienceElasticSearch experienceGo Lang experienceIstio ExperienceOur TechWe are always willing to learn new technology, have enough grit to fail and keep going and, most important of all: we don't hire assholesOver half the company is in the engineering team with a culture of working with the most modern and best tools for the jobDesigning state-of-the-art algorithms to empower our recommendation engine; including model ML and DL libraries.Our tech stack has a React Native frontend; GraphQL, Typescript, DGraph, MongoDB backend; Kubernetes in GCP for infrastructureWhy Bonsai?This is your opportunity to join an early-stage technology startup and work with a team of 35 smart and dedicated colleagues who love what they do. We have healthcare coverage, competitive compensation, top of the line Apple equipment, bi-weekly company-sponsored events, and all the stuff other startups are offering you (company swag, flexible working style, free food, unlimited coffee, ping pong table, lots of puzzles, etc).More importantly, we invest time in helping each other grow. We have the most thorough on-boarding plans of any startup, career plans made for everyone at the 90-day mark, weekly 1on1s, blameless postmortems for all teams, and give feedback on all take-home assignments, even those that don t advance in the hiring process. We anticipate rapid growth in the coming years, which will allow you to learn and grow with us!

title: Big Data and Analytics Cloud Consultant, Google Cloud Professional Services
descr: Minimum qualifications:Bachelor s degree in CS, Engineering, technical field or equivalent practical experience.3 years of experience project managing and delivering technical solutions.Experience with architecting, developing, and/or maintaining technical solutions in virtualized environments.Experience in systems design and architecting or explaining systems interactions, including data flows, common interfaces, APIs, and methods available.Preferred qualifications:MBA or Master's degree in CS or an engineering field.Cloud certification.7 years of experience demonstrating technical client service.Experience with reading software code in one or more languages such as Java, Javascript, Python.Experience designing and deploying large scale distributed data processing systems with one or more technologies such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Hadoop, Spark, HBase, Vertica, Netezza, Teradata, Tableau, or MicroStrategy.Demonstrated excellent communication, presentation, and problem solving skills.About the jobAs a Big Data and Analytics Cloud Consultant, you will work directly with Google s most strategic customers on critical projects to help them transform their businesses. You will provide management, consulting, and technical aptitude to customer engagements while working with client executives and key technical leaders to deploy solutions via Google s Cloud Platform.You will also work closely with key Google partners currently servicing top accounts to manage programs, deliver consulting services, and provide technical guidance and best practice expertise.You possess a diverse background with cloud solutions in areas such as architecture design, infrastructure fundamentals, and deployment strategies. To be successful, you know how to navigate ambiguity, have extensive experience working with cloud technologies, have technical depth, and enjoy working with client executives. You also possess excellent communication and project management skills. Travel will be approximately 30% of the time for client engagements.Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what s next for their business   all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers and developers see the benefits of our technology come to life.ResponsibilitiesWork with customer technical leads, client executives, and partners to manage and deliver successful implementations of cloud solutions, becoming a trusted advisor to decision-makers throughout the engagement.Work with internal specialists, product, and engineering teams to package best practices and lessons learned into thought leadership, methodologies, and published assets.Interact with sales, partners, and customer technical stakeholders to manage project scope, priorities, deliverables, risks/issues, and timelines for successful client outcomes.Advocate for customer needs in order to overcome adoption blockers and drive new feature development based on your field experience.Propose solution architectures and manage the deployment of cloud based big data and analytics solutions according to complex customer requirements and implementation best practices.At Google, we don t just accept difference we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

title: Performance Engineer, Vault
descr: At Veeva, we build enterprise cloud technology that powers the biggest names in the pharmaceutical, biotech, consumer goods, chemical & cosmetics industries. Our customers make vaccines, life-saving medicines, and life-enhancing products that make a difference in everyday lives. Our technology has transformed these industries; enabling them to get critical products and services to market faster. Our core values, Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed, guide us as we make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do.The RoleOur Vault team is developing an innovative, cloud-based, Regulated Content Management product suite to transform the way life sciences companies manage critical documents, from product development in the research lab through clinical trials, FDA approval, manufacturing, and commercialization.Our engineers work hard, have fun, share ideas, and collaborate regularly. They work closely with our product managers and other engineers to develop product details and are responsible for seeing their product features or projects through the full development life cycle.We are seeking an experienced Performance Engineer with a passion to make cloud applications fast and efficient. You will work with developers to test and optimize Veeva Vault software pre-production, and also monitor and troubleshoot performance issues in production. This is a technical, hands-on role for someone who is adept at gathering and analyzing performance data and finding the root cause of performance bottlenecks.What You'll DoCollaborate with members of the Engineering team to solve performance problemsProfile Java application performance using YourKit and other proven tools and techniquesMonitor production performance and investigate issuesDevelop tools to automate performance monitoringTest and profile new features pre-production to make sure they will scale and performRequirementsProficiency with Java, MySql and scripting tools such as Python and Shell scriptingProficiency with Linux and the various tools and techniques used to debug performance problems from the OS all the way up to the highest level JavaScriptExtensive hands-on experience with performance engineering, including the use of JMeter, LoadRunner or similar tools, as well as profiling toolsExperience working on teams using agile development techniquesWillingness to roll up your sleeves and work hard (and have fun) in a fast-moving startup environmentStrong communication skillsLocal to GTA. We have offices in downtown TorontoBS in engineering/science or equivalentNice to HaveExperience with YourKitDebugging distributed applicationsProficiency with JenkinsJira expertisePerks & BenefitsConveniently located in downtown TorontoSnacks, beverages, and weekly lunches from local restaurantsTeam events and rec league sports teamsAllocations for continuous learning & developmentHealth & wellness programsWeekly yoga classesPing pong and other gamesVeeva s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.Veeva Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we are committed to fair and accessible employment practices. Veeva Systems welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Full Stack Engineer
descr: ChefHero is looking to expand its Engineering team with experienced and dedicated Full Stack Developers. We're building a product that's changing the face of the restaurant industry and we need the experience of someone like you to help us get our product to the next level!As a member of our agile Engineering team, you will have the chance to help modernize our product by introducing new technology and building new features to complement existing functionality. The Engineeringing team is growing and full of opportunity.We're a fun, hardworking bunch that is revolutionizing the restaurant and food service industry.If this seems like a recipe for success, we'd love to meet you.Your Role:Work across multiple teams and with multiple key stakeholders (engineers, QA, product manager and designers) from requirements all the way to production to build maintainable, scalable and high-quality products.Work across the entire stack including backend services (APIs and micro- services), front end, databases, automated testing (unit and integration).Work with the Engineering team to ensure best practices (e.g. code reviews, code coverage, deployment and sprint rituals etc.)All other duties within the scope and spirit of the position.Our Stack:Our platform and applications run on Google Cloud. We build backend services using Python and Go, a web frontend with React and Redux, and native Android and iOS applications.Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent education/experience.2+ years' experience working as a Software Engineer or in a similar capacity.Experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, etc.)Experience with React/Redux or any popular frontend framework.Experience working with multi-tier architectures and complex backend systems.Experience with designing, developing, securing and consuming web services (REST or gRPC).Ability to know your way around a Linux server and have some DevOps knowledge.Experience with unit testing and test methodologies.Ability to follow best development practices (e.g. Agile, clean code, unit tests, continuous integration) and apply your experience to new and evolving environments.Solid understanding of software design principles and be passionate about new technology.Experience with profiling and code performance tuning is a plus.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with all team members.Are passionate and ever-curious about technology.Benefits:While the best benefits are learning a ton and loving your job, we also offer:Full health, life and dental benefitsDaily lunch via Ritual creditMinimum vacation. We insist you take a minimum of 3 weeks annually, but feel free to take moreParental leave benefitsWeekley demo days, monthly socials, and much more!About ChefHero:ChefHero is a wholesale food marketplace that connects restaurants to their suppliers. ChefHero is a free mobile and web application that allows any restaurant to order all their supplies in one easy place. ChefHero conveniently allows customers to collaborate on orders with their sous chef, view prices and products that are updated daily, customize their order sheets, order local or organic food, reduce human error and easily track their invoices.At ChefHero we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require any accommodation during the application or interview process, we will work with you to meet your needs.eWJwFH9DUa

title: Tools Support Specialist
descr: Job DescriptionUbisoft Toronto Inc.224 Wallace Avenue. In 2018, Ubisoft Toronto developed its first new IP, Starlink: Battle for Atlas. Ubisoft Toronto is one of Canada s Top 100 Employers for four consecutive years and in 2018, one of GamesIndustry.biz Best Places to Work.Tools Support SpecialistIn the fast paced world of video game creation builds need to be created multiple times per day. Managing all of the pieces that need to come together will be your primary duty. Under the supervision of the Lead Programmer, you will also test and validate the production engines and tools. data;Develop other tools or scripts for the needs of the project;Manage all rights and access to project data;Create a ClosingKit to archive all data related to the project during the end phase of the project;Carry out all other related tasks.Training:Diploma in computer science or equivalent, Bachelors in computer science would be an asset.Relevant Experience:Minimum 1 to 3 years  experience in testing, ideally in the video game industry;Previous experience as a Release Manager / Build Engineer an asset;Experience with 3D modeling tools or other relevant experiences.Essential Skills:Understanding game production pipeline and tools;Advanced computer (Windows, Linux, VM) and network (TCP, UDP, load balancer, firewall etc.) knowledge;Knowledge of C++, C#, Python and Perl;Knowledge of Perforce, MS Dos Batch files, Atlassian Jira task tracking, Active Directory, Windows API;Version control management and continuous integration systems (QuickBuild, Jenkins, etc.);Knowledge of Web Technologies (HTML and others);Capacity to document test cases and bugs;Good judgment to estimate the significance and consequences of the bugs;Rigorous and methodical, autonomous and resourceful approach;Strong interpersonal and communication skills;Passion for video games and the desire to have fun at work!Other Skills:Knowledge of production tools (Photoshop, 3DS-Max, Maya, Unreal editor);Modern video game console experience (PlayStation 4, Xbox One);Knowledge of other  Source Control  systems (CVS, Subversion, Git etc.);Knowledge of other languages such as C, PHP, Unix Shell Scripts, JAVA Script or VB script;Knowledge of Secure Transfers, PGP, SSH and Tunnel;Knowledge of Installshield, or Wise.We Offer:Competitive SalaryComprehensive Benefits Package:o Disability Insuranceo Dental Insuranceo Extended medical insuranceo (Optional) RRSP contributiono Relocation assisstanceo Bonus (If Applicable)Why Ubisoft Toronto?Scored by The Economist as the Best City to Live, our studio is located in the trendy Junction Triangle located in West Toronto, close to TTC, the hottest bars and restaurants, and excellent coffee shops. We celebrate successes as a team at our monthly UbiBash events, and invite our families to events throughout the year including our annual Kids Holiday Party. We give back to help make our community better through our team volunteer days and fundraising activities. We hold regular game jams to fuel our team s creativity. Ubisoft Toronto conducts annual performance reviews to help our team develop their careers and grow with our studio, and provides the opportunity for salary increases annually as part of the performance review process. Ubisoft Toronto also offers a comprehensive health benefits package, generous RRSP matching, industry education support, training and career development, flexible days, on-site Yoga and Bootcamp classes, fresh fruit, Life Drawing classes, as well as spontaneous team surprises such as Pi Day, Star Wars Day, and Halloween.Join Us!We hunt for talent from across the industry   seasoned experts that know what it takes to ship world-class games and the next generation of game developer all-stars. We value team chemistry and a desire to grow our studio together. If this sounds like your kind of studio, what are you waiting for? Apply to join us now!Ubisoft Toronto is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all interested parties. The studio welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodation upon request for candidates taking part in the recruitment process. We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies please.

title: Manager, Engineering
descr: About Blackhawk Network:At Achievers, our software delivers a powerful new way for companies to engage, align, and recognize employees enabling remarkable business success. Every day.We hire ambitious professionals who thrive on their entrepreneurial spirit and want to Change the Way the World Works. title: Senior QA Automation Developer
descr: Who we are:Founded in Toronto in 1988, CaseWare International Inc. is a global software provider for accounting firms, corporations, and governments. With efficiency, quality and value in mind, we build solutions that push the technological boundaries in the industry. Our approach combines the power of automation with secure collaboration tools to help customers reach new levels of productivity and make better business decisions. As a result, CaseWare solutions are used by over 250,000 users in 130 countries and in 16 languages. We have embarked on an ambitious new path of delivering an innovative, cloud - based unique global reporting and auditing solution. We are looking for a full-time Automation Tester to join our growing team of Desktop development in an Agile environment.What s in it for you?You will have the opportunity to work with QAs, developers, product owners and release team, so good communication skills are a must.What it takes?Your passion, great attitude, excellent communication skills, willingness to explore and awesome teamwork is all what will help you hit the ground running.We need you to:Your primary role will be to use your programming skills to create scripts for automation tests.You enjoy developing with code but you like to explore the user flows from a tester perspective.You will participate in hands-on testing, write and execute automated tests and contribute to the quality assurance of the software under test.You ll be expected to support the testing effort by acquiring domain knowledge while applying your technical expertise.RequirementsWhat you bring:Technical Skills:Hands on 5+ years of test automation experience with API testingHighly proficient in test automation tools, including but not limited to Rest-Assured, Postman, Jmeter etc.Hands-on experience with creating scripts for the purpose of automation with one of these languages Java, C# , PythonExperience with building automation frameworksIn-depth knowledge and experience with software testing and automated testAbility to create test strategy/plans and establish test tasks at project levelAbility to design and develop complex testsAbility to procure/create test data required for testingHave actively participated in an agile team, engaged in standups, ceremonies and provided inputs to the team in order to improve the test process.Ability to be the voice of quality during testing, raising issues when needed, and highlighting risk.Become familiar with software under test and any integrated componentsAbility to differentiate whether test scenarios can be automatable or better executed manuallyAbility to replicate and report defects in JIRA or similar toolKnowledge of a test case management tool, eg. TestRail, ZephyrExperience with version control systems and build tools, e.g. GIT, Jenkins, BambooExperience with integrating automated tests into continuous integration pipelines e.g. JenkinsDesired Skills & Experience:Experience in ETL and data warehousing is an assetKnowledge of Fin Tech industry is an assetSoft-Skills:Ability to Multi-taskGood Communication and collaboration skillsA Team PlayerYou Possess:University/College degree in Computer Science/ Computer Engineering or equivalent*** Selected applicants will be required to complete a one hour technical assessment. ***BenefitsAt the heart of CaseWare is our unique culture, which lays the foundation for who we are, what we do, and where we are going. In this digital age, driving innovation involves transforming the way people think and act. With this in mind, Caseware is committed to three core values Community, Excellence, and Innovation. These values support our vision, informs our culture, our behavior and enables us to provide our clients with greater efficiency, quality, and value. To give you an idea of what we mean, here are our core values:Have fun creating great customer experiencesYour work is a reflection of youCelebrate us all the timeEgo is the enemyImpossible   What s that?S* happens   adjust and learnDon t be afraid of chaos and discomfortDo what you say & say what you meanGive abundantly to your family, team and communitiesNote: If you have a cover letter to submit, we would love to know what excites about this role and how it fits in your career goals.

title: Vice President, AI Engineering
descr: The Vector Institute is seeking a talented and experienced VP of AI Engineering to lead our engineering and staff scientist team working alongside machine learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning and other AI researchers and on applications projects working with a growing number of sponsor companies and partner organizations in academia, industry, healthcare, and government.PROFILE OF IDEAL CANDIDATEYou are a strong technical visionary, comfortable with and respected by scientists and business leaders, with extensive experience managing groups of highly skilled individual contributors. A results-driven, customer-centric thinker, you deliver operationally-efficient, cost-effective and innovative technology services and solutions to the research institute.You have a track record of setting budgets and timelines that are met and are constantly on the lookout for ways to further improve technical processes and adoption of new technology, within the budgets and committed timelines. You are familiar with and have a track record of achieving compliance with audit-friendly processes and highly effective security practices. You are a pragmatic resource manager with appreciation for the expediency needed for agile prototype experimentation and dependable artifact maintenance.An effective team leader, with demonstrated group facilitation and presentation skills, you have a knack for inspiring highly qualified diverse technical staff to work together on common goals and are a developer of people who successfully meet business and professional developmental objectives.You have experience in start-ups, especially at the early stages of staffing and organizing a software R&D team from scratch, and with cloud-computing based software development or service offerings.You are likely currently a VP or Director of Engineering in a small to medium sized software technology firm using data analytics or machine learning, or a project lead or senior manager in a large information technology firm developing algorithms or machine learning tools or workflow systems, who is ready for and looking for exactly this kind of exciting opportunity to play a key leadership role in contributing to Vector s success in helping Ontario and Canada realize the potential of machine learning.Reporting to the President and CEO of the Vector Institute, you are a member of the senior leadership team and in this key role you will contribute to Vector s success in realizing our vision, mission, and strategic objectives.SELECT KEY RESPONSIBILITIESScope out and staff for Vector s cutting-edge AI developments, transfer AI technology to sponsor and partner organizations and operate a leadership class machine learning computing facility;Execute on and ensure successful completion of projects, AI developments, technology transfers to sponsor and partner organizations, and AI computing facility initiatives on time and within budget;Effectively build and lead a diverse team of highly skilled technical staff who are engaged and who deliver on commitments to researchers, sponsors, and partners;Manage a portfolio which includes prototype, platform and infrastructure software development, upskilling developers and researchers on recent open source and proprietary AI system developments, R&D support services for small and large projects with researchers and/or partner professionals, and procurement and operations of large-scale computer clusters with hybrid utilization of cloud computing services;Act as a trusted and credible spokesperson for Vector, performing public speaking engagements on behalf of Vector on AI technologies, Vector s accomplishments and directions;Recognize, capture and develop intellectual property for the benefit of its inventors, Vector resources & partner organizations; andPerform other technical and leadership functions, as requested by the CEO, which contribute to Vector achieving its vision, mission, and strategic objectives.KEY SUCCESS MEASURESThe Engineering team at Vector is fully staffed, effective, and successful in fulfilling commitments to our stakeholdersInternal and external clients understand and are proficient achieving conditions and expectations under which the engineering team can be expected to succeedBudgetary and other commitments are respected and delivered onQualitative client feedback on projects assigned by Industry, Academic, Healthcare, and Research leaders at Vector is uniformly positive and reflective of great value providedOverall allocation of technical resources by portfolio (Academic, Healthcare, Industry, and Research) is appropriate and in line with guidance providedVector sponsors renew sponsorship agreements expressing positive feedback on AI projects and teamsSKILLS AND EXPERIENCEYou have a PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent field and/or many years of technical leadership in R&D for innovative information technology software firms, and more recently, machine learning applications for AI industry labsYou are a highly effective communicator and relationship manager with demonstrated proficiency in collaborating successfully with diverse stakeholders.You are familiar with the operations, design, utility and weaknesses in the popular ML/DL/RL systems like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe, Scikit, Matlab, R and popular analytics systems such as Tableau, Spark and Hadoop, and with popular cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenStackYou have proven experience with open source development, community decision-making, project management, maintenance, and encouraging deployment of large software artifacts, especially ML/DL/RL/AI cutting-edge systemsYou have strong direct, if not necessarily recent, programming experience in modern languages such as Python, Rust, Scala, C++ and Linux shell scriptsYou have experience in start-ups, especially in the early stages of staffing and organizing a software R&D team from scratchYou have experience in leading, funding or collaborating with academic research projects, graduate student interns, or university sponsored researchYou have strong time management and organizational skillsYou have experience inventing or commercializing intellectual propertyYou are comfortable working with a diverse range of clients (e.g., leadership teams, operations staff, graduate students, and external partners), maintaining confidentiality and providing all with a trusted, respectful point of contactYou possess a positive attitude, integrity, a sense of humour, and bring a positive energy and outlook to a not-for-profit corporate cultureYou are motivated by continuous learning and the opportunity to make a difference and a real contribution to the AI ecosystemPlease address applications to Kailyn Burke, HR Generalist. We thank all applicants for their interest in this exciting opportunity and will be in touch with those whose qualifications most closely match with our needs.The Vector Institute is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, racialized persons/visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and LGBTQ+ persons. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply.Further, we are committed to fostering an environment of inclusivity and accessibility. If you require an accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment and selection process, please contact Kailyn Burke at kailyn.burke@vectorinstitute.ai and we will happily work with you to meet your needs.

title: Toronto AI Lab: AI / Machine Learning Scientist
descr: At LG, we make products and services that make lives better, easier and happier through increased functionality and fun. Put simply, we offer the latest innovations to make  Life Good    from home appliances, consumer electronics, vehicle components and mobile communications to business innovations in digital signage, air conditioning, solar and LED lighting. As a global leader, we strive for greatness in product leadership, market leadership and people leadership to realize our growth strategies.Talk about a mantra. Life s Good with LG!AI/Machine Learning Scientist   TorontoLG is looking to push the boundaries of AI to build innovative product and service solutions to realize LG s global vision for a connected world. As a part of this initiative, LG has set up an Advanced AI organization in North America centered in Silicon Valley. Further to this initiative, we are looking for passionate and talented AI / Machine Learning Scientists and Engineers for our Toronto AI Lab to work closely with the global AI labs.You will work on advanced research to make core ML and RL algorithms faster, more accurate and more robust. You will design experiments, invent new algorithms, and create prototype implementations focusing on applications to a variety of challenging business problems in areas of IoT, Connected Home and On Device Computing. You will be encouraged to publish high quality papers and patents and collaborate with leading academia.You will be based in our new offices in downtown Toronto and work alongside a multi-disciplinary team that includes ML/AI scientists, product managers and software developers to design and launch AI products and solutions that help predict, personalize and transform lifestyles of LG s global footprint of devices and users.Seniority will be commensurate with experience and accomplishments.Principal Duties and ResponsibilitiesResearch and develop advances to improve core AI/Machine Learning algorithms. The research focus includes (but is not limited to) the following:Network optimization, parameter and hyper-parameter optimization, architecture search, network compressionModel adaptation and learning on the edgePolicy learning and adaptation in RLBayesian machine learningSemi-supervised and unsupervised learningDistributed learningRead, understand, implement, and improve state-of-the-art papers in the above topicsTake ownership of projects and build proof-of-concepts (POCs)Actively participate in the research and academic community by disseminating novel results in top conferences and journalsStay up-to-date on developments in AI technologies and propose long term research plansRequirementsPhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics or related quantitative discipline with a focus on machine learning, optimization theory, or related areasStrong publication record in machine learning and deep learning at top conferences and journalsA demonstrable track record of developing novel algorithms, solutions, and delivering/deploying prototypes/projectsExperience with deep learning frameworks (e.g., Keras, Tensorflow, Tensorlite, MxNet)Software engineering experience in two or more of C/C++, Python, Scala, Java, R, MatlabExperience working with edge-computing frameworks like, CoreML, Greengrass etc. preferredLast, but not least, a sense of ambition and passion to change the world using AI and machine Learning
